episodeTitle: Hot Full Throttle! The Twins' Magnetic Power Draws Near
japaneseTitleRomanized: Atsukurushisa Zenkai! Semaru Futago no Jiryoku Pawā
japaneseTitle: 暑苦しさ全開！迫る双子の磁力パワー
description: Sanji and Usopp are captured by the ice-skating couple Salchow and Arbell. Meanwhile, Campacino arrives to rescue his imprisoned twin brother Brindo, and the magnetic twins use their unique 'Combination Play' abilities to separate and attack Luffy. Elsewhere, Zoro meets Don Accino and discovers their stolen Jolly Roger flag.

events.title: Salchow and Arbell Chase Usopp and Sanji
events.description: The ice-skating couple Salchow and Arbell pursue Usopp and Sanji across the frozen terrain. Sanji attempts to fight while standing on Usopp's back to avoid slipping on the ice.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' struggle against the Accino Family's tactics and the icy environment.

events.title: Sanji and Usopp Fall Into Freezing Water
events.description: Salchow and Arbell use their ice skating skills to crack the ice beneath Sanji and Usopp, causing them to fall into freezing water where they are attacked by penguins before being captured.
events.significance: Results in the capture of two Straw Hat members, raising the stakes of the conflict.

events.title: Campacino Arrives to Rescue Brindo
events.description: Campacino, the elder twin brother of Brindo, arrives at the Phoenix Pirates' ship via a magnetic ice platform to rescue his captured brother from captivity.
events.significance: Introduces Campacino and sets up the twins' magnetic combination attack abilities.

quotes.text: Where is my brother? I'm coming to get you!
quotes.speaker: Campacino
quotes.context: Campacino calls Brindo via Den Den Mushi before arriving

events.title: Twins' Magnetic Combination Play Revealed
events.description: Campacino and Brindo reveal their unique ability called 'Combination Play,' where their brotherly bond creates a magnetic attraction - Campacino glows blue while Brindo glows red, allowing them to attract or repel each other magnetically.
events.significance: Introduces a unique fighting technique based on twin bond rather than Devil Fruit powers, setting them apart from typical antagonists.

quotes.text: Our brotherly love creates magnetism between us! This is our Combination Play!
quotes.speaker: Campacino
quotes.context: Explaining their magnetic powers to Luffy

events.title: Twin Pistol Debut
events.description: Luffy uses Twin Pistol attack against Campacino and Brindo, attempting to counter their magnetic combination abilities.
events.significance: First appearance of this Gomu Gomu no Mi technique in the series.

events.title: Twins Separate Luffy From His Crew
events.description: Using their magnetic powers, Campacino and Brindo force Luffy away from the Phoenix Pirates' ship and onto the surrounding ice, separating him from potential allies.
events.significance: Demonstrates the tactical effectiveness of the twins' combination attacks.

events.title: Puzzle Offers Himself as Ransom
events.description: Captain Puzzle demonstrates his reformation and care for his crew by offering himself to the Accino Family in exchange for his crew's freedom.
events.significance: Shows Puzzle's character development and his genuine desire to protect his crew.

events.title: Zoro Enters Don Accino's Chamber
events.description: Zoro encounters Don Accino in an intensely hot chamber within Lovely Land. The two share drinks together, with Zoro unaware that Don Accino knows his identity and is plotting against him.
events.significance: Sets up the confrontation between Zoro and the arc's main antagonist while showcasing Don Accino's deceptive nature.

quotes.text: Let me show you my collection of pirate flags. I've gathered quite a few over the years.
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Don Accino boasting about his flag collection to Zoro

events.title: Straw Hat Jolly Roger Presented to Don Accino
events.description: One of Lil's birds delivers the Straw Hat Pirates' stolen Jolly Roger flag to Don Accino's chamber while Zoro is present. Don Accino reveals he knew Zoro's identity all along and values his 120,000,000 berry bounty.
events.significance: Reveals the central conflict of the arc - the stolen flag - and exposes Don Accino's true intentions to Zoro.

quotes.text: I knew who you were all along, Roronoa Zoro. That 120,000,000 berry bounty of yours is quite hard to pass up.
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Don Accino revealing his knowledge of Zoro's identity

events.title: Zoro Confronts Don Accino
events.description: After the revelation about the stolen flag and Don Accino's true intentions, Zoro prepares to battle the patriarch of the Accino Family in his heated chamber.
events.significance: Begins the major confrontation between Zoro and the arc's primary antagonist.

quotes.text: Our brotherly love creates magnetism between us! This is our Combination Play!
quotes.speaker: Campacino

quotes.text: I knew who you were all along, Roronoa Zoro. That 120,000,000 berry bounty of yours is quite hard to pass up.
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Revealing his knowledge of Zoro's identity and intentions

themes.description: The episode explores different types of family bonds - the twins' magnetic connection, Puzzle's protective feelings for his crew (found family), and the Accino Family's coordinated bounty hunting operation.
themes.symbolism: The magnetic attraction between the twins serves as a literal representation of familial bonds and loyalty.

themes.description: Don Accino's friendly facade while plotting against Zoro demonstrates how appearances can be deceiving, contrasting with the genuine bonds between the Straw Hats.
themes.symbolism: The hot chamber represents the hidden danger beneath Don Accino's calm exterior.

themes.description: The stolen Jolly Roger represents the crew's identity and pride, making its theft a personal affront that must be avenged.
themes.symbolism: The pirate flag collection symbolizes Don Accino's dominance over defeated pirates.
culturalReferences: Pirate flags have historical significance as symbols of identity and intimidation

characterSpotlights.development: Campacino is introduced as Brindo's elder twin brother and demonstrates their unique magnetic 'Combination Play' abilities.
keyActions: Arrives to rescue his brother Brindo
Separates Luffy from allies using combination attacks
quotes: Our brotherly love creates magnetism between us!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro's encounter with Don Accino reveals his concern for the crew's flag while also showing his tactical disadvantage due to Don Accino's heat powers threatening his swords.
Don Accino's deceptive nature is revealed as he pretends to befriend Zoro while planning to capture him for his bounty.
keyActions: Shows off his pirate flag collection
Reveals knowledge of Zoro's identity and bounty
quotes: I knew who you were all along, Roronoa Zoro. That 120,000,000 berry bounty of yours is quite hard to pass up.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his character growth by offering himself as ransom to protect his crew.
keyActions: Offers himself to the Accino Family in exchange for his crew's freedom

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ice Hunter Arc is anime-original filler content and does not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode features the debut of Luffy's 'Twin Pistol' technique, a variation of his standard Gomu Gomu no Pistol attack.
The twins' magnetic powers are not based on Devil Fruits but on their brotherly bond, making them unique among One Piece antagonists.
Episode 331 aired on November 18, 2007 in Japan, but didn't air in the US until January 30, 2016 - over 8 years later.
Starting with episode 326, One Piece extended its opening themes from 110 seconds to 150 seconds and stopped using ending themes, which continued until episode 1071.
The Ice Hunter Arc is the eighth filler arc in One Piece and the second-longest anime-original arc, only surpassed by the G-8 Arc.
